In this perspective, the strategy of separating the objective of preventing the deterioration of the state of surface and underground waters from the objectives of protecting, improving the quality of the same should not be pursued, constituting a superfluous priority scale at the expense of an organicity of interventions and specific measures aimed in the combined approach and in the use of the best available techniques.As regards the elimination of pollution produced by dangerous substances in the aquatic environment, the optimization of the approach should provide for regulation, both nationally and community level, to allow a better identification of the different types of polluted water bodies as a consequence of human production activities.Finally, it is necessary to constitute a system that prepares a list of potentially dangerous substances, through the greatest number of information about the chemical, physical and biological properties, in order to create an integrated model of intervention at different strategic levels, with the safeguarding of the good water, which is fundamental for all of us.Mr. President, the goal of the directive must be to ensure that the Member States ensure a combined protection of surface and underground waters and drinking water, and that the level of protection is compatible with the community legislation in force in environmental matters.I am allowed to remember that the decisions already approved about the nitrate directive have not yet been applied to various Member States, despite being a decision of the Union.The proposal in question contains a series of more severe provisions regarding the protection of the aquatic environment that go beyond the environmental objectives currently in force.The directive proposes that for the marine environment the final objective of concentrations close to the value of environmental concentrations for existing substances in nature and close to zero for synthetic substances attributable to human activity must be achieved.This is impossible, not only, but it is also against nature.The approval of this report will have serious consequences on European agriculture, to the extent that the concentrations for example of phosphorus and nitrogen cannot exceed the value of the environmental concentration of these substances in the aquatic environment and to the extent that you want to fix a zero limit value for pesticides in the aquatic environment.Thus European agriculture cannot devote themselves to the cultivation of bakery cereals with a protein tenor sufficiently high to allow the use of these cereals for bakery.The result will be that agricultural production will move to other countries outside the union, with all the socio -economic and employment consequences that this entails.I will not be able to vote in favor of the provisions of the Framework Directive on the waters that deal with the aspects stated.Mr. President, honorable colleagues, water is a precious resource.Millions of people do not even have clean water, an essential prerequisite for survival.It is therefore no wonder that water is the basic motif of some wars.The capitalist world also places its pawns in order to exercise maximum control over water reserves.Rarely proves to be solidarity or think of the general interest.Europe therefore has a difficult task in front of it: integrating community policy on water, fragmented both in terms of objectives and means, giving life to a more cohesive framework legislation.

The importance of the safety of road transport, railway and in internal navigable routes is undoubted and given the international character of this type of transport, also training courses for safety consultants must be harmonized, such as, for example, for the next new ADR.All this is important, but equally essential is the implementation of current regulations.There are several reasons to pay attention to this aspect, just look at how many accidents have produced in recent years in the event of fog in Belgium, or in Holland or in other countries.There are many accidents in which trucks that transported dangerous goods were involved and that in these weather conditions should not have been traveling instead of being quietly on the roads.Or we think of ships from Eastern Europe countries that surf into clearly dangerous conditions.From investigations conducted in Belgian, Finnish and Japanese ports, it has also emerged that 50 percent of containers containing dangerous goods are not delivered in compliance with current regulations.In short, the importance of the theme is enormous.As regards the situation of security consultants, in some Member States starting from 1 January of this year, companies must have obligatory internal.Currently the problems created by this rule are many, especially for smaller companies, which do not have sufficient financial means.Consequently, these companies are forced to give up their load or mix it with another load, with the serious problems that this generates.For this reason, companies are asked to integrate these activities in financial reports, or in company analyzes, to be inserted in ISO 9002 certifications. The regulatory framework is ready, now we must deal with its implementation.Allow me to indicate a last point, always concerning the application of the rules.Satisfactory agreements with the countries of Eastern Europe must be made, given that they will join the treaties on the subject only from 1 July 2001, that is, only between a year and a half.These countries now enjoy a slight competitive advantage, which is not serious.However, I believe that aspects that concern the safety of road transport, railway and navigable streets, and promptly present this part of the Community acquision to the countries candidate for adhesion should be priority.Mrs. President, in this parliament, rightly, the importance of transport safety is regularly in full.The ever -growing volumes of goods that cross Europe involve, consciously or not, risks of all genres for staff, the environment and society.Therefore, those who have to manage the aforementioned risks must meet very rigorous requirements.The rules sanctioned in another directive, Directive 95/35/EC, seem adequate enough to provide responsible advice on the organization of transport of dangerous goods.I rejoice that I have reached an agreement with the Council regarding the minimum requirements for the exams of security consultants, although I would have preferred that uniform rules and programs had been formulated to guarantee the equality of diplomas internationally.

We must take into account the advice of fishermen.We must take into account the concerns of fishermen and we must work closely with them.I hope that you will take into account, as a commissioner responsible for fishing that you will become aware of this ditch and that you will try to work as closely as possible for all parties to be united and for their opinions to be taken into account.Thank you, Mr. Commissioner Fischler.The debate is closed.The vote will take place tomorrow at 11 a.m.Insolvency procedures The agenda calls for the report (A5-0039/2000) of Mr. Lechner, in the name of the legal commission and the internal market, on the proposal for the settlement of the council relating to the insolvency procedures (9178/1999 - C5-0069/1999 - 1999/0806 (CNS)).Mr. President, I believe that we are all agreement for the creation of a European judicial space.We also agree that there is harmonization in an area marked by an extreme disparity in our legal systems, and even more concepts.The very word of insolvency, the legal concept of insolvency, does not cover the same accounting notion in each of the Member States of the Union.So we agree on the observation, and the draft settlement and the report go in the right direction.If I may afford, I will make some observations, however, on the method.When we take note - and we could not do otherwise - of the disparity of legal systems and concepts, and that we want to go in the direction of better coordination, I believe that there are three ways to proceed.The first is to make equivalences saying: ultimately, insolvency in France is the same as insolvency in England or in Germany.The second way of proceeding is to recreate an ex nihilo law, that is to say to harmonize systems, to completely redesign all concepts and legal systems in each of the states.It is not the way that has been taken.The third way that was taken is finally to superimpose, above existing systems, which we do not touch, a real embryo of Community law of collective procedures and the company in difficulty.It is a good thing, and the result has probably exceeded the ambition of the authors.But at this stage I would like to make an observation, which is not technical, but more philosophical and inspired by practice.It is that insolvency is experienced in the European Union, in most states, as an absolutely definitive event for the one who lives it.And I think that it is our responsibility, in an economy that goes faster and faster, where everyone must have their chance and have it really, to give the chance to try a commercial enterprise, and a second, a third chance if it is necessary.

C5-0308/1999 - 1999/0199 (CNS)].On behalf of the Council, Mr. Seixas da Costa has the floor.Mr. President, Ladies, on behalf of the Presidency of the European Union Council, I would like to give some information about the resumption of intrachipriots negotiations and the recent evolution of that issue.I consider that what happened in Helsinki at the end of last year and the new environment that is lived in the framework, in particular, of the relationship between the European Union and Turkey reflects - it is clear for all - a backdrop in the community level that cannot cease to be sensitive to also the relationship of relationship between the two communities, in the field of chipre.I would like to underline that at the beginning of December last year, the first round of negotiations was held in New York - since several years ago interrupted - among the Cypriots communities of the north and southern the island.They were indirect conversations, mediated by the United Nations special representative, Álvaro de Souto.In January of this year - from January 31 - another round was held and it is planned that on May 23 a third round will begin in New York and there is the possibility, not yet confirmed at all, that these conversations are direct and continuous, so that their work would last until September of this year.The substantial aspects in that debate are essentially four: security, government structure, territorial adjustments and refugees and compensation resulting from the situation created after the island's division.However, the possibility of including other issues had been agreed, so the representative of the northern part of the island, Rauf Denktash, proposed three new themes: sovereignty, the creative measures of trust and the lifting of the embargo on the products of the north of the island.From the conversations so far held, two results have been essentially obtained: the possibility of structuring a direct channel of information between the European Union and the northern part of the island has been made -without necessarily meaning its recognition as an entity with legal personality at the international level -in order to facilitate the approval of a community collection for a possible adhesion of the entire island, in the case that in the case of a resolution of the global problem.The division of the island.The second result that seems important to us is the declaration made by the United Nations Secretary General at the end of the first day of conversations, stating that, if a global agreement was achieved for the situation, it would entail recognition of the specificities of the north of the island.

left and right, top and bottom in this house.That is why I find this application No. 3, which Mr. Piecyk formulated as a rapporteur, wonderful.He completely avoided the word harmonization.But he said what it was about.He said that it cannot be that the benefit of a commercial vehicle, a bus with passengers without compliance with the safety regulations - which leads to the endangerment of life and life of humans - is considered in a country as a cavalier offense and is seriously punished in another country.In view of the risk of passengers or the other road users, this would be necessary.Therefore, this is not the question: Are we for subsidiarity or are we for centrality?The point is that it is not concerned that we have the common goal of traffic safety, but some governments say: well, from the punishments we consider violations of traffic safety such as violations of the ban on entering any green areas, and the others weight it correctly.First principle, vice president: the same assessment of the need to improve traffic safety.The second argument is that there must be no distortion of competition in the community.There are examples that the trucks of another Member State in a country are particularly keen to control, be held, held, etc., and in another country it doesn't matter.That is the core of the difference between parliament and a common point of view: We already believe that the Member States should try to vote in connection with the sanctions that remain in their national jurisdiction: How do I rate the risk of traffic, and how do I make the equality of competition within the community in an internal market?

I would like to approach a point of great importance concerning the impact on businesses, raised by Mmes Thyssen, Peijs and Palacio Vallelersundi: these are SMEs.Many speakers have pointed out.The Commission pays particular attention to legal certainty for SMEs.We propose a system that considerably improves legal certainty for SMEs.For what ?Is it just a political gesture?No.In this system, we propose to reform our important rules in such a way that most SMEs are covered by regulations in terms of exemption by categories, as in the field of vertical restrictions.Most SMEs have less than 30 % market share.We have a minimis notice containing the following declaration: Since SMEs are not involved in market domination, they are not normally subject to the strict prohibition contained in article 81, paragraph 1. We are in the process of developing exemptions by categories and additional guidelines which will take all accounts of the particular situation of SMEs.In addition, our white paper on modernization will also improve the situation of SMEs, first of all by the elimination of the bureaucracy resulting from the current notification system and secondly, by making article 81, paragraph 3, directly applicable, which will benefit in particular SMEs.(IT) Fourth, legal certainty.Admittedly, Mr. Evans, legal certainty is - I am the first to recognize it - essential for companies and not only for legal professions which however play a very important role in favor of European construction.Legal certainty is essential for businesses, this is one of the subjects including the president of the Legal Commission and the Internal Market, Ms. Palacio Vallelersundi - that I thank for her way of following the issues related to the single market in the broad sense and therefore, in this case, competition too - also underlined the importance in her latest intervention.I am convinced that this proposal will increase the legal security of companies, for three reasons: it will allow, without prior decision, under the direct effect of article 81, paragraph 3, all restrictive competition agreements satisfying the conditions of exemption;It will assist companies in case of doubt in terms of interpretation through the publication of motivated opinions;It will be accompanied by exemption regulations and guidelines aimed at clarifying the rules and ensuring its certainty.Ms. Thyssen also referred to the question of legal privilege for business lawyers.Allow me only to recall that the Court of Justice decided this question, as you know better than me, in 1982. This jurisprudence remains valid and nothing justifies that it is questioned.The white paper imposes a review of the question for only one of its aspects: the exchange of confidential information.The guarantees that must be given to companies are currently the subject of discussions.(IT) I come now, Mr. President, quickly to Mr. Rapkay's report, whom I warmly thank for the quality of his work and for the support given overall to the XXVIIIth annual report of the Commission on the Competition Policy.

However, knowing and valuing precisely all situations and expectations is a little less than impossible task.I belong to a country whose half south appears to the Mediterranean and in which the availability of water historically responds to the whims of a volatile weather and a difficult conformation of the land.The Mediterranean region has had to fight for its development trying to overcome this adversity century by century, year by year, day by day until today.Therefore, we think the practical application made by the directive of the obligation collected in article 164 of the treaty related to the fact that community legislation takes into account the diversity of its regions.Precisely in application of this principle, the Spanish delegation of the European Popular Party will oppose the amendments 4 -Considerate 21-, 13 and 49 -Article 11, letter d) -, since they suppose a serious limitation for an exclusive management area of ​​the Member States such as the regulation of their water resources.It would be very difficult for the community to determine the conditions for its regulation in the different regions, given the different internal balances that are always at stake and that in any case require a deep knowledge of the different areas and interests affected.We also reject the amendments that seek to incorporate the full cost of water for the year 2010. Undoubtedly, we must set water prices that encourage their efficient use but, at the same time, allow maintaining the competitiveness of the productive sectors in the most disadvantaged regions and does not prevent their legitimate development.I want, finally, to refer to the amendments related to dangerous substances that establish that a degree of pollution zero or close to zero must be reached.The degree of zero pollution of any human activity has not yet been discovered.Ladies and gentlemen, we would do a bad service in general to the objectives of this important directive if we are not able to provide it with the necessary flexibility and adaptability to guarantee its compliance.I hope that, once again, this Parliament votes with a sense of reality and respect for the principle of subsidiarity, seeking an adequate balance between environmental objectives and economic and social considerations, the three essential elements to achieve the sustainable development that we all want so much.Mr. President, Mrs. Commissioner, this is a very important directive.Its objective is to improve the quality of water and the safety of distribution systems.Citizens must have the right to clean water.This is important for both the environment and for public health.I do not speak so much in its own name, since it is casually part of the small group of privileged Europeans who can drink water directly in the nearest lake of the neighborhood.We must strive to quickly start the improvement of water quality.Let's start working now.We cannot afford delays.It is important that the calendar is ambitious.In my opinion, it is not too ambitious, if we take into account that the objective is that by 2020 we stop pouring impurities in the waters and we aspire that, by that date, the discharge index of impurities and harmful materials will be reduced to zero.

itself.The EU must now choose between the desire to establish its relations with Israel and Palestine on the standards of international law, and thus strengthen the peace process, or do no case of international law.The choice should be simple.International law prescribes us not to set up commercial relations only with the countries and regions it recognizes, and not with territories whose membership is disputed.EU member states and Israel must comply with the rules contained in the trade agreement on the strict control of the origin of the products, and customs duties must be returned.He returns to the commission to watch.The intervention of Commissioner Vitorino gives us some hopes in this direction.You have to give a chance to the peace process in the Middle East.And this chance can only be based on international law.The EU is responsible for contributing to it.Mr. President, Messrs deputies, I would first like to thank all the deputies who made a rich and outline, the Parliament is due to a strategy certainly prudent, but clear, which the Commission will also adopt to deal with this issue.The Commission does not ignore the political sensitivity of this theme and no doubts at any time because the progress aimed at finding concrete solutions for a concrete application of this trade agreement is closely linked to the evolution of the peace process in the Middle East.In fact, the political importance given to the peace process by the European Union finds an echo in Parliament and to the Commission, as pointed out by several deputies, and this interest results from the recent visit in this region of Madam President Nicole Fontaine, as well as Mr. President Romano Prodi last week.This is why we are well aware of being living a particularly without flooding through surveillance measures, without illegal use of video conferences;So that the Union never gets back to processes in which the judges instead of speaking right;So that the real culprits are punished and not innocent people who are uncomfortable to anyone.President!The draft of the Convention on Legal Aid in Criminal Matters between the Member States of the European Union is about to accept his acceptance by the Council.Most say it is time for it.After the action plan to combat organized crime, which was accepted by the Council in April 1997, work on the draft of the MLA Convention should be completed before the end of 1997.However, further time will pass before it will actually come into force in view of the fact that the ratification by the Member States is necessary.Even according to the new rules of the Amsterdam contract, which provide an entry into force, if at least half of the Member States have accepted the Convention, I would like to ask the Member States to do everything in their power in order to ratify this agreement as quickly as possible.Unfortunately, the experiences of the past in relation to the ratification of the European Union Convention in the area of ​​Justitial Cooperation in Criminal Matters are disappointing.With this Convention, no new or other system of legal assistance should be created.Rather, it aims to build on proven mechanisms that have been around for a very long time and how they provide for the European legal assistance agreement of 1959 and the Benelux contract.The draft created by the Council contains provisions on a variety of things that have been discussed by various MPs.It is a remarkable achievement of the Convention that the requested Member States, where possible, have to stick to the formalities and procedures, refer to which the requesting Member State refers.This is particularly important with regard to the possibility of using judicial evidence.

hardest confronted with speculation that affects monetary fluctuations in the short term.I don't think it is unfeasible more.Why would it not be possible to identify an agreement between the states of from one place to another.Madam President, as Mr. Karas said a few minutes ago, we do not ask for an additional bureaucracy.We are looking for solutions.There is no doubt that it is more clear on the Corrie, this situation is criticized and the adherence to the parity assembly at the Lomé model is affirmed, but a second problem, which is basically also based on erroneous free trade policy, namely the incoherency of the regional trade agreements concluded by the European Union, is not sufficiently emphasized.The best example is the cooperation agreement with South Africa.The Council approved this agreement negotiated by the Commission, although the agricultural chapter, which was nevertheless, has not yet been finally regulated.As our colleague Paul-Marie Coûteaux aptly noticed in his with Mexico.The rapporteur's claim after integration of the European development fund into the budget of the community is also not acceptable.We would like to protect the clear obligation and responsibility of each Member State, as the intergovernmental character enables.Unfortunately, we have experienced too many examples in which the common help for which nobody feels responsible, we A call to the majority of the Austrian people who have not voted for Haider, who has voted clearly democratic options, committed to Europe -and I have to point out that if Mr. Schüssel was a Minister of Finance, Foreign Minister Vranitzky also gave a hand in the Austrian integration process.You cannot be so politically sectarian.The entry of Austria in the community did it together.It was everyone's work, not a single group.Therefore, Mrs. President, I think we are in our right and in our obligation to ask the Austrians to reconsider and reconsider because that type of plague that we have already suffered in Europe can not only harm Austria, it can, where appropriate, extend, and speak with the memory of history.Therefore, I would like to know if the PPE, apart from the apology he has made of Mr. Schüssel, who will guarantee everything, as in 1938 Chamberlain and Daladier did so in Munich, plan to take measures in relation to the Austrian Popular Party if he goes on with this delirious project.Thirdly, if we do not rise against this Contramos Alliance, I can tell you, lordships, that the main objective of the European Union, which is the extension, can be terminated because, if you were Czechs or Slovenos or Hungarian, what would you say if they have a neighbor that deals with a racial base and does not want me to enter?Therefore, lordships, I think this is a great day for the beginning of political Europe.We support the Council and believe that we are in our right and in our obligation to address the Austrian people to seriously reconsider this absolutely delusional option.(Applause of the PSE group) Mrs. President, my group welcomes this debate with satisfaction because we are at a decisive moment.It is the first time in the history of the modern European project that we are about to attend the integration of a party of the extreme right.It is something deeply disturbing.The FPö argues that if we read its documentation and its program, we will find many things that we could share.It may be so, but today I want to record the long and difficult experience that the Democratic liberals live with the Austrian FPö party in our family of the Liberal International.Already in 1986 we had reasons to believe that Mr. Jörg Haider was not a man whose principles or attitudes were consistent with modern decency and liberalism.In November 1991, after a long internal debate in the Liberal International and numerous visits to Vienna to deal with problems, we suspended the FPö association and in July 1993 we expel it.We expel it then and too many families have been destroyed.As far as the current conflict in the Basque Country is concerned, the opposite has happened in Spain and France.We from the Euskal Herritarrok are firmly convinced that the current struggle can only be ended through an open dialogue and transparent negotiations without a rigid agenda.In the nineteen months before January 20, there was only one murder in the Kingdom of Spain, namely the attack on ETA member Luis Geresta, who died in March 1999.Despite this attack and the arrests made by the Spanish and French police, also by ETA members who were in negotiations with the Spanish government, the ETA kept its one-sided ceasefire.In November last year, before the end of the ceasefire, the spokesman for the Spanish government, Mr. Piqué, said that his government had so far done everything to do so and that everything will do everything that will be able to prevent current efforts to find a political solution for the Basque Country.We, the Euskal Herritarrok, have often had to regret the loss of human life.Together with the Basque population, we carry the suffering of our people.We are for a dialogue and we are ready to work with all those who are striving for a democratic solution for the Basque Country.Since the Northern Ireland question was addressed for the first time in this parliament, twenty years have passed.

With these global documents, aren't we reinventing the Gosplan Mr. President?One can ask, especially when reads the French contribution that exaggerates in the sense of leadership by proposing that a whole series of national policies be coordinated in Brussels, for example in the fields of employment, social protection or SMEs, and by accompanying them with a wide battery of encrypted indicators whose surveillance should have been organized.A centralized control of this type would be translated by new violations of subsidiarity, new detail uniformizations, new pressing coordination imposed on countries that are in different situations, in a word new elements of rigidity that will be added to the rigidity of the single currency.The Lisbon Council should be set as a goal, in our opinion, eliminate that rigidity, foster flexibility, adaptation, exchange positive national experiences to stimulate creativity that will only prosper thanks to the freedom of choice of peoples.Mr. President, Mr. President of the Council, distinguished colleagues, in the speeches we have heard, a sublime objective has been mentioned, specifically, the objective that, as Europeans, we become competitive in front of the United States, we become interlocutors of the United States into equal rights.Actually, this should be possible if we consider our gross domestic product.However, if, on the other hand, we consider, for example, in the field of people - at the time of finding a new president of the FMI - how Europeans behave at this point in front of the Americans, then we are, without a doubt, still far away from this collaboration in equal rights.Now, we have to ask ourselves why this is.There are sectors, certainly, in the economic field - even in the field of media - in which we have leading positions.I refer, for example, to mobile phones.Here, in the plenary room, we have prohibited them with full reason, as they are instruments of torture.But, at the same time, in some areas they also constitute a substantial help in life, because they generate jobs.In this area we Europeans go in the lead.Because?We are in the lead because we have managed to reach a common European regulation in this area, a common European standard that has become a world rule today.This means that if we, Europeans, we strive on time, we will also be competitive in this area of ​​new technologies.Where are Europe's deficit?I believe, Mr. President of the Council, that we cannot eliminate the deficit instituting more observatories, as is currently planned.I believe that these observatories generate a few jobs for officials, but do not create jobs in small and medium enterprises.In Europe we have deficit in the training level.This indicates that in the field of new media we have to make imports from countries outside of Europe.Europe lacks, as has already been said, business, entrepreneurial spirit.

Essentially - with a legal modification - the Commission will systematically move away from the current centralized system of preventive approval of each financial transaction by the financial controller and instead strengthen the internal control systems of the expenditure of the departments so that the general directions are more equipped to take responsibility for the decisions that may affect the budget of the European Union.In addition, to have more guarantees than those provided by the current system, the new decentralized control system must be accompanied by an internal audit service - the second key, as the honorable Bösch called it - in line with the recommendations of the expert committee.This service will begin to operate on May 1 of this year, will be guided by a highly qualified accounting auditor, and its independence must be and will be guaranteed through new provisions to be added to the financial regulation.The new service will have to respond to me of his work, and will be joined by an audit committee chaired by colleague Schreyer, who I am happy to see tonight in the classroom. As a commissioner for the budgets, it is already responsible for relations with the Court of Auditors.This audit committee will ensure that the internal accounting reviews are then followed effectively and rigorously.I want to underline forcefully that modifying our control systems does not mean making them less severe.The proposed changes will make the most effective systems both as regards the information they will receive, and in relation to the weighted and responsible results they will provide.I can also explicitly guarantee the classroom that we will not adopt what is sometimes called "a big bang approach".Financial checks in force on the expenditure of each organ will be abandoned only after the new internal control system on the expenditure of each department has shown that it is fully adequate.I am a bit surprised that paragraph 10 of the resolution project does not seem to move any fundamental criticism of the current centralized character of financial control, contrary to both reports of the Committee of independent experts.This committee said very clearly that it is necessary to abolish the centralized system so far in force, and has also been explicit on the need to separate the internal accounting reviews from financial control.I also do not believe that paragraph 10 of the resolution project fully reflects the opinion expressed by the Court of Auditors in 1997. Of course, the Court may, after careful reflection, express its opinion towards the changes proposed for the financial regulation, but it is useful to remember the comments made in the classroom last month by President Karlsson.He said that the internal control of the Commission is not effective enough to prevent incorrect operation.For example, the financial controller had granted the preliminary visa in most cases of bad management and irregularities recently discovered.In addition, the internal accounting review function is carried out, without adequate coordination, by various bodies, such as the financial controller itself, the general inspectorate and some units of the general directions.Originally the centralized preventive approval system was undoubtedly suitable for guaranteeing adequate control, but with the passing of the years it has ended instead to reduce the degree of responsibility of officials on decisions.

We are looking forward to interest and confidence of a concerted strategy for modernizing social security systems in Europe, which, however, must not be separated from a parallel rapprochement process: this means modernization, but also cohesion, as the rapporteur, to which we agree, highlighted in his report.In many policy areas, this latter path, although under trouble, was initiated, but in many others it has to be hit before Europe, be it, be it, even when considering the principle of subsidiarity, really a common house not only for the citizens of the Member States, but also for the people of the accessible countries.The European systems of social security have also always played a positive role in the social and democratic development of every people;And since these systems today have to continue to act as support for development in view of the further development of the economy, the world of work and the needs of society, they must of course be modernized.Nevertheless, we would like to emphasize three aspects: First, there must be a closer, directly proportional connection between economic policy, employment policy and social security policy.Second, it is about managing the systems of social security and their carriers.Nowadays, more extensive and effective measures are taken in the area of ​​additional and supplementary provision.In our opinion, however, this should not mean that the role of the public sector is weakened, both because of the universality and because of the - desirable - quality of the basic services of social security.This is basically a principle of justice that applies to the healthcare system, for the pension systems, but also to the social welfare sector, in which the public sector of the strategic coordination - which - albeit in a new form - cannot evade.The third aspect affects the principle of subsidiarity, which is based on the Union.To date, there is no common strategy of social protection and social security, and the applicable systems are essentially based on the procedure and on solidarity within the Member States.When modernizing these systems, the differences between the individual states - be they now member or membership states - are not neglected in the areas of economy, employment and social protection.The modernization, which is closely associated with a process that is closely based on different requirements, must therefore strive and promote developments in the sense of an increase and not a lowering of the social protection level.This is a question of culture, progress and the common dignity of the current and future expanded European Union.The common values ​​of the Member States of the European Union are based on democracy, human rights and freedom as well as a social market economy.This spirit must be expressed in solidarity with the weak groups in our society and the outside world.In accordance with the subsidiarity principle, the Member States design their social security systems themselves. However, all citizens of the European Union should be able to enjoy a minimum supply by a social security network, regardless of the country in which they live.In the report, an "effective and ambitious tax coordination" is required without define it in more detail.In our view, such an opinion means too much intervention in the national tax policy and therefore cannot find our support.

It is high time that polluters are starting to pay because, until now, the victims and taxpayers pay.And not only that they pay, but that in addition they clean the affected areas.I therefore welcome socialist group, a message of solidarity to victims, fishermen, aquaculturers and oyster farmers and to industrialists who ensure that seafood occasionally arrive on the markets;to mayors and political leaders, volunteers who have cleaned.We tell them about all our solidarity.I would like to ask two questions to the commissioner.Parliament has adopted a resolution on the application of the principle of polluter pays for this type of case and on the responsibility of the shipowners and owners of the goods.The question I ask the Commissioner is whether we can really apply these principles and if we will receive compensation from these people?The second point concerns the future and publication of the white paper of the Commission on environmental responsibility, the object of which is to guarantee in the future the application of the principle of polluter pays and to improve our ability to enforce European environmental law.This white paper admits that responsibility is only effective if the polluter is identifiable, if the damage can be quantified and if one can establish a clear cause and effect relationship between the two.The sinking of the Erika could not better illustrate this point because it sums up exactly what the white paper intends to tackle.This question would therefore seem to be the best measure to deal with such problems in the future.The proposal for a directive provides for a faultless responsibility for the damage caused by dangerous activities regulated at community level and I wonder -and the commissioner may perhaps answer this question -, if the white paper on environmental responsibility will be able to answer problems such as that of the Erika, if it will really be able to respond to this concern or if, in practice, in the practice of maritime accidents involving ships locatedPollutors will once again escape the obligation to pay compensation to repair the damage they have caused.Mr. President, our sympathies and the expression of our solidarity go to the people and the regions that have been affected by the disaster.But good intentions are not enough, the damage must be compensated and the losses compensated both with regard to the restoration of the environment and the conchyl installations and the fishing tools.We are happy to hear the Commissioner announces the need to act and compensate quickly and in a retroactive manner.We also denounce too lax control of ships and we are in favor of the creation of a European coast guard body, and in particular the requirement of more restrictive regulations and the requirement to have double hull boats.

This is a transparent and strong way of proceeding, to involve all European institutions and the European population.This White Paper is a response to the challenges that the expansion requires us, expansion that forces us to rethink the functioning of all our institutions, to rethink our own policies - to all our policies - to rethink above all what we must continue to do at the level of union when the member countries will be twenty -five or thirty, what it will be better to do at the level of the individual states, at the level of the regions and at the level of the local administrations.But it is not only the expansion that pushes us to this rethinking: as mentioned above, it is also the same globalization of the economy and politics.We must govern Europe in order to be more efficient, closer to citizens, promoting everyone's participation, first of all starting from the great problem of female participation.One of the great differences in the comparison made in this period between Europe and the United States is not so much the mobility of the work or the problem of risk capital, but rather the participation of the woman in economic life, a participation that in the United States has much more importance compared to Europe.It is a field in which Europe has always been at the forefront: on this we must therefore reflect with depth, with opening, and all the institutions - Commission, Parliament, Council - will have to think of their role, their policies.We will therefore immediately get back to work on this white photographer, even if to complete it we will have to wait for the results of the intergovernmental conference, and therefore it cannot be presented before spring 2001. It will not be a philosophy book, but a concrete book, full of precise proposals.We - the Commission - first we know that we must rethink totally, and for this we will do two things: we will work and we are fully engaged in the internal reform, and we will rethink our policies in depth.I asked all the commissioners - and we will ask for it even more analytical - to identify all the activities that can be abandoned.The Commission must define what its fundamental activities are, those on which it must concentrate, and give in non -essential activities, in order to free new resources and to have a more correct and more cooperative relationship with the individual countries, with the regions and with local communities.We will therefore free new resources, but the moment will also come - I fear, and I want to affirm it here in front of Parliament - in which even these new resources that we are already freeing will not be sufficient to allow us to face our new tasks: I think about expansion, the new sector of justice and internal affairs, the health problems, the problems of the environment.On that day, when we have used all our resources to the maximum, I will not hesitate to present myself in front of you to ask for new resources, but I say to now that if we do not have the necessary resources, we will have to refuse to take any new task because there is no consistency among the new tasks that we take on and the resources we have.

The fundamental discussion point with the Council will obviously be the endowment which Life III must be provided.The common position provides for a financial envelope of 613 million euros for the period 2000-2004, it is insufficient.The Liberal group is favorable to the increase in this amount to 850 million euros.We therefore support the amendment of Ms. Lienemann who notes that the endowment of Life was not increased during the last enlargement of the Union, not to mention the next train of new arrivals.The sums we ask for do not constitute by a Himalayas of unnecessary expenses.On the contrary, they are still very modest in relation to the needs to be covered.A drop of water - I would say - compared to the structural policies of Europe.The environment remains a very poor parent of the European budget, even though it constitutes above all an investment.Investment in natural resources, of course, but also in employment, since it has been shown that an active environment policy created new workstations, for proof in particular the very great success of LIFE: success with NGOs, companies, local authorities, third countries.Nearly a third of the 8,500 requests received met the required conditions and approximately 1,300 projects could be co -financed between 1992 and 1998. A success that Parliament wants to see, intends to see permanent, which is why we also support the amendment 14 sketching the fourth stage of life of the Life project.When it comes to environment, investment and ambition are available, must be available in the long term.The future of future generations is at this price.Mr. President, Madam Commissioner, I will probably repeat what my colleagues are said but I believe that, for advice, it is still and still repeating what we think of Life.So, I would also say - as the rapporteur has already done very well - that Life is the only specific financial instrument for the implementation and implementation of the European Union policy.This system is absolutely essential because it promotes truly innovative actions in favor of nature and the environment in Europe, which are taken up and amplified by the Member States.This financial instrument is, moreover, voluntarily democratic by being accessible both to government organizations as to NGOs.It is why, dear colleagues, that I will ask you not to vote the amendments that have understood nothing in the spirit of Life.Indeed, through associations, Life is directly usable by the European citizen, and for the benefit of actions of general interest.Several million - I have said millions - of NGO members recognize in Life the will of the Union to build an ambitious policy in favor of the natural heritage.Life is, moreover, the fundamental instrument of the Natura 2000 network in Europe for which the Member States have invested, in accordance with the community guidelines on rare and threatened flora and fauna habitats and on migratory birds, and which allows the implementation of the protection of high -value biological sites in our states.

the Commission, she claims to build a new Europe, but unfortunately she lacks an essential requirement: trust.In fact, the trust of millions of Europeans cannot be conquered since they have not worthy.And how could you be worthy of it after the scandal of the crazy cow, after the resignation of the shrer commission for corruption?It is your responsibility of the millions of unemployed, the for scrapping are being faced, in order to guarantee the fulfillment of the principle of gratuity.I understand that colleagues from other countries in which cars are not built say that manufacturers my opinion, we need this directive.First, because it clearly collects the objectives of the environment.Secondly, because it can foster recycling, and that is important.Third, because it constitutes a It therefore seemed essential to fill this gap to reach a high and uniform level of training for security advisers, but also to avoid a disparity between training costs and, consequently, an impact on I will make today are not far from those I made at the time.They come down to this: I regret that, in an area as crucial as the transport of dangerous goods, we always put back in the next day the adoption of harmonized standards to the detriment of the safety of men and the environment.I will recall that a directive on the reconciliation of the laws of the Member States concerning the transport of dangerous goods by road entered into force on January 1, 1997. This included a certain number of transitional provisions valid until January 1, 1999. It was from this date that we should have pronounced on a proposal from the European Commission aimed at ceasing these derogations.According to the procedure in use, it is the European Standardization Committee (CEN) which proposes the standards in this field, which are then registered in the European agreement relating to the international transport of dangerous goods by road signed in Geneva in 1957 (better known as ADR acronym), which applies throughout Europe and whose provisions serve as the basis for the law applicable in the EU.The CEN has not been able to carry out its work in the allotted time.Consequently, the proposal of the commission that we discuss today aims to modify the directive to solve these short -term problems and not to put an end to the transitional regime as should be the case!This is exactly what happened for the transport of these goods by railway, with this difference: a period had been arrested.

especially the commissioner - and the Council for our good relations and, in addition, to the Secretariat of the Commission for its generous work.In the commission there has been great unanimity, except at one point, in which I hope we will also agree.The OICVM issue seems complicated, full of political and technical risks.I think there are those who do not even know what OICVM means.However, allow me to affirm that this issue really concerns European citizens, that is, in the way their savings are handled, to the possibilities of choice offered, to the operation of competition between countries in savings, to security demands by investors and their possibilities to save intelligently for old age.It is about compensating the demands for liberalization to improve the market and obtain greater benefits with the protection and safety of investors.During the 1980s, most European markets experienced considerable liberalization.This was a consequence that, especially national values ​​markets, they developed with great speed for some years.Then the collective investment funds became an alternative to bank savings.In my own country, more than 60 percent of Swedes invest in different funds.Savings in funds, which is based on the wide base of its investments.The capital and values ​​market has continued to develop.The current OICVM directive has been outdated.New types of funds have been introduced in some member countries, which cannot be offered in others.

Mr. President, Mr. President of the Council, Mr. Commissioner, dear colleagues, I think it cannot be repeated with sufficient frequency and intensity that what the Council has agreed as a agenda for the next intergovernmental conference is politically absolutely unacceptable and add how embarrassing.We are in a historical situation in which we are negotiating with 12 member states or we will initiate negotiations and in the situation in which the joint growth of Europe can come true in a predictable time.But how can the union be expanded if now, that is, before the extension, do not things do well?Therefore, our political group is in favor of the Intergovernmental Conference.It seems irrevocable and urgent and we hope you really throw results that make possible a prompt expansion of the European Union.Mr. President of the Council, my political group has taken note with the satisfaction that the presidency of the Council is not satisfied with the current situation.Therefore, it is sure that the Confederal Group of the European Left European / Left Nordic Green is going to work so that the Union finally does its tasks.It is neither more nor less than the future of Europe and especially of a Europe that citizens understand as their own because they can participate in their configuration and because the concerns, problems and issues that are really moved are really taken seriously by politics.The policy behind closed doors, deliberations in silent cliques, all this has to end once and for all.Therefore, transparency is absolutely necessary.I think that as a presidency of advice, you should take care that the train does not continue to shoot as until now and that people are not left behind in platforms as illiterate in matters of treaties.It seems inalienable not only that everything is done to thoroughly inform citizens about the evolution and results of the Intergovernmental Conference but also should be included much more intensely in the entire reform process.It also seems to us that the politicians who adopt the decisions must finally do something and, once the intergovernmental conference is over, ask citizens and citizens through referendums how their Europe should continue to develop.Thus we would really have a Europe of citizens and a new totally new quality in the democratic legitimation of the Union.I will refer to another central democratic issue.As a member of the Assembly that has just started its work with the Charter of Fundamental Rights, I mean that both of me and my political group is not enough for us a solemn statement of the Charter.What will citizens say if rights are solemnly announced but if they cannot be claimed individually by judicial means?No, I think this would further deepen the credibility crisis of the Union.

think it is important to say that Andalusia will receive 50 % more in the community framework and that Spain also displays a record in terms of structural funds, which means that the distribution is question to the Commissioner: do you think that the regulations of the application of the structural funds or the current distribution criteria should be changed to you seem acceptable?I find this debate exciting.I understand that he has a dimension that is not exclusively community.That said, you have to get used to the idea that there are permanent elections in all the countries of the Unfortunately, more than a year after the presentation of the proposal, the other body of legislative power, the Council, has not yet begun to deal with it.I hope this debate will serve to remind Member States the importance and urgency of this initiative.We recently learned from the Portuguese presidency that is about to begin a serious discussion on this proposal.Even the French presidency, which is about to bring the Portuguese one to use the Portuguese one, seems willing to recognize this dossier the priority importance he deserves.The Commission expresses the sincere hope that Parliament and Council quickly carry out this important dossier which in our opinion constitutes the most effective response for fears aroused by cases such as those of which it was discussed here today.As for the participation of transnational workers, there is some clues that at least in one case the companies have broken the transnational information and consultation agreements that had concluded with their workforce in the European field, or at least it is possible that they have exploited some ambiguity of the current legal and contractual framework.The Commission will contact the competent national authorities to check this point.However, I want to reassure those who fear that their rights on the subject have been injured: the appropriate implementation and compensation tools are at their disposal, in particular by means of the competent jurisdictional requests at national level.The Commission is aware of your request to proceed immediately to a review of the directive on European business committees.As stated in the report that we will approve over the next few weeks, we recognize that the directive allows some escapades.However, my colleague, Commissioner Diamantopoulou, has already reiterated on other occasions that in deciding on the possible and immediate revision of the directive, other considerations will have to be taken into account.First of all, any revision of the directive would have a little immediate effect on the agreements in force, unless you want to suspend the application of the fundamental principle that provides for the respect of the autonomy of the parties involved in the negotiation.Secondly, an immediate revision would greatly complicate the situation for the other dossiers open in this field, such as European corporate statutes and the proposal for consultation and information at national level.The success of these dossiers could greatly facilitate the subsequent review of the European Business Committees Directive and indeed providing, to some extent, a solution to the problems identified.This is why, in this context, it seems more appropriate to proceed with the revision of the directive on European business committees only after the conclusion of these two dossiers, and after having more carefully evaluated the application of the directive.Our action is not limited to the legislative field.To encourage and support dialogue as a fundamental element of a happy adaptation to change, the Commission is also developing the recommendations of Lillehammer's report, with the preparation of a European observatory on industrial changes.We are also working on another starting point offered by that group of experts, that is, the relationship on the management of changes.Finally I would like to face some of the other concerns expressed in the resolution project presented to Parliament.

I would like some changes to the assembly, in particular after the conclusion of the new agreement in May.A greater equality between ACP partners and European members must be ensured and I want us to free ourselves with "their and us" syndrome.First of all, I would like to see a parliamentary parliamentary assembly of elected members of the ACP countries and not of ambassadors or government ministers present as delegates.I think this is the new agreement.Second, the new agreement provides for the performance of regional meetings in the six areas concerned, which would allow us to be more specific in our work.Regional assemblies should send reports to the joint assembly.We had a regional discussion in Nassau in the Caribbean and it was an extremely productive experience.We will also keep another in Abuja in West Africa.I want the assembly to stop being only a headquarters of discussions and becomes a laboratory for the improvement of the conditions of all peoples in developing countries.I want more voice to civil society.To do this, however, it is necessary to put an end to the problem of corruption, a problem that must be addressed with the utmost solution.We must reward those nations that strive to respect the rules of good governance.In the same way, we must be stopped with those that are corrupt or whose constitutions do not allow the establishment of the pluralistic governments we requested.I am very satisfied with the result obtained in Zimbabwe.European taxpayers will no longer accept that their taxes are used for fraudulent purposes.A new wind of change must blow through Africa and it is necessary to set new rules and respect them.The joint assembly must play a leading role in controlling respect for the principles of good governance, human rights and democracy in collaboration with the Commission.I believe that the elected delegates ACP and EU are up to the task as equal partners and I ask you to approve the relationship.Mr. President, I would first like to congratulate the Honorable Corrie for the excellent and exhaustive relationship.At the basis of any reflection in the field of development policy must be respecting the rights of man and the fight against poverty.The reduction of resources in the sector of aid to development, in many member countries and in the European Union, is in strident contrast with the intention of fighting against poverty.As for the crucial problem, the funding, in an optical time to the future, must be equipped with the joint assembly of additional resources, which serve to send electoral observers at the request of ACP countries.In the future, the European Union, in defining development projects, must, from one song, orient itself on several fronts and, from the other, better agree on your position with individual states, to work more efficiently and use the funds with greater effectiveness.We can mention the education sector as an example, which deserves and needs particular promotion, in the future, in the ACP countries.The lightning development of the potential of training and technology on the internet has revealed the existence of completely new tools to bring developing countries closer, with their still modest means, to globality, but not to globalization.

The failure must certainly not be blamed on the European Parliament.It is the governments of the Member States that have so much restricted the scope.This poses an almost unsolvable task of the European Parliament.One should make friends with the thought that every opportunity to be taken to make a better legal aid.Paradoxically, I could say: It would be best to speak as little as possible about this report.The more we make it clear that it is only very small steps, the more organized crime rubs their hands, and the more clearly the blatant disability between the organized crime and the acute lack of legal cooperation.I emphasize the Council of Ministers emphatically to finally take note of reality.Above all, he should see that crime is proportional to the codification.The goal is to give the judicial authorities - especially judges and prosecutors, but also the citizens concerned - to give instruments for fighting crime without pronouncing the fundamental rights of defense and the general principles of human rights.Otherwise we only fight the symptoms, but not the causes.I therefore primarily advocate the further harmonization of criminal law in the Member States of the European Union.In my opinion, crime can only be combated in this way across borders.As long as this harmonization is still pending, you should be consistent if you want to enable legal aid.For this purpose, I had submitted an amendment, according to which legal assistance may only be provided if the authorities have initiated a persecution law for actions due to actions that are punishable according to domestic law of the requesting party and according to the Member State requested.Incidentally, I find the content of my amendment application in a change application 43, which also places this cumulative condition.This prerequisite is essential, since in my opinion the legal principle in criminal law "Nulla Poena Sine Lege" must be respected.As a result, every request for legal assistance in relation to a act that is hypothetically incorrect in the requested Member State contradicts this legal principle and consequently also to the basic principles of law in the requested Member State.It is therefore extremely important that this cumulative condition is accepted.Finally, I would like to repeat that colleague Di Pietro did a great job in my opinion.He has submitted a report in which all conceivable guarantees are offered for the maintenance of individual human rights and fundamental freedoms in view of the limited possibilities.If we want to convey a greater security of security to the European citizen, we have to strive for justitial cooperation.Mr President, my faction welcomes the fact that an agreement is created in order to put the daily practice of legal aid in criminal matters in rules.With the regulation, the rights and obligations of states or citizens are to be laid down with each other or in the relationship between citizens and the state.The present draft is complex: it deals with agreements between the Member States, but also has far -reaching consequences for the relationship between the citizens and the state authorities.

That is the position adopted by the United Nations Secretary General and is an element that must be present, naturally, in our future analysis.There are some hopes regarding the third round of negotiations, given the proposals of plans that are in preparation and in which representatives of the United States and the United Kingdom intervene, in particular in the spheres of security and constitutional structure, which, as expected, will be presented in said round by mediation of the representative of the Secretary General of the United Nations, which will occur in a frameApril.For the rest, the Portuguese presidency of the European Union, following the example of what they did previous presidencies, has decided to indicate a representative so that they have contacts with the various interested parties in this regard, who has already contacted them and, in close relationship with the representative of the Secretary General of the United Nations, has been following the works of several rounds.In particular, we intend that the European Union permanently maintain an active attitude in that regard, the more so that there is the circumstance that Cyprus is, as evident, a candidate for adherence to the European Union with a fairly advanced negotiation process, which naturally raises some hopes and determines that the European Union has a role of some relevance in that framework.The orientation that we have been following in that debate and our participation in it has essentially consisted of taking advantage of a climate of appeasement of the tensions created by the conviction, commonly - it seems - shared, that it is necessary to continue negotiating and that the continuation of the negotiations and the maintenance of their rhythm are also, in themselves, elements of hope regarding the conclusion of a final solution.There is also another important element, already cited at the beginning of my statement and related to Türkiye's commitment to contribute to the preparation of the north of the island for adhesion.We consider that we must not only read with some attention, a certain detachment, the conclusions of the European Council of Helsinki, but, in addition, we must observe the availability of the Turkish authorities to contribute to the resolution of that issue.I was in Ankara myself, where I had the opportunity to speak with Prime Minister Bülent Ecevit in that regard, and, although we know the difficulties, the specific sensitivity and the idiosyncrasy of the Turkish approach of that issue, I consider that an window of opportunity opens that it cannot be missing.To do this, you have to combine several factors, one of which has to do - it is not worth hiding - with the dynamics of the relationship between Türkiye and the European Union.That is an essential element for the future of this issue.On the other hand, it seems important to us - also in relation to the way as the European Union addresses the essentials of that issue - that the exchange of information between the commission and the chipriotas of the north of the island is encouraged, without that meaning - it must be clear - any type of official recognition.

rejected the proposal of the European mediator, Mr. Jacob Söderman, to grant citizens a guarantee of good administrative conduct in the European Union (EU).The Commission itself approved the idea of ​​a code of good administrative conduct, but did not accept the detailed proposal which was made of it.Instead, it has advanced a set of additional indications for a better service.Is this information exact?Why does the Commission act in this way, and how does it explain the difference thus born between discourse and action relating to the reform of the EU administration?Does she believe that this approximate.The Commission approved at first reading, in November 1999, a code of good administrative conduct to include in its regulations.At the moment, the Commission consults its staff representatives about the document, a process that will be finalized in the following weeks.The Commission will then adopt the code at second reading.It should be noted that the new commission has given immediate follow -up to the European mediator's decision of July 28, 1999, in its initiative investigation concerning the administrative code of conduct.The Commission would like to emphasize, in particular, that it has taken into account, in the drafting of the code, of all the projects of recommendation of the European mediator.The code will exclusively deal with relations between the administration of the commission and the public.It will be adopted through a decision of the binding commission on the legal level which will be published in the Official Journal of the European they are already going back to 1997. The information reported by the press was misleading.I don't think there is a difference between us and the mediator.

Section 3: Mr. President, I think there is a translation error in the Swedish text;It would have been fun that the European left had expressed concern about an eventual increase in tax revenues tax.We voted as we wanted to do it, but there was a translation error in the Swedish text, and I want to record.We know that the commission will soon reform common fishing policy.This proposal for the regulations of the Board is the first of a series that will allow to specify this reform.Fishery data collection and management is essential for good common fishing policy management.These data must be reliable, be elaborated independently and be accepted by all the participants of the sector, the politicians and those responsible for the application of that PPC.The text of the regulation proposal has been amended relatively importantly in the Fisheries Commission.The totality of the deputies of our group has voted in favor of these amendments both in commission and in plenary.The amendment 1 allows to clarify the text significantly.Indeed, collected data should not be used solely to scientific use.Scientists must deal with this data and transmit them to the competent political authorities, responsible for decision making.It is nevertheless essential that the compilation method is carried out scientifically justified.Amendment 2, meanwhile, modifies the initial proposal of the Commission.The commission's proposal, in effect, involves the elaboration of very detailed studies boat by boat and company by company.In addition to the extraordinarily high cost that implies this proposal, the heavy management load could lead to some administrations to put this complexity as a pretext so as not to provide the information in due time, and cause feelings of distrust in professionals in the sector, if they are imposed so heavy supplementary bureaucratic loads.Regarding the second part of the amendment, it is important to count and characterize much better the losses of jobs in the sector.The management of a common fishing policy, must not forget it, must include a social dimension in terms of statistical analysis.The amendment 3 allows to add an important dimension that is the compilation of environmental data.It is possible to measure the especially serious effects that data of this type are not taken into account through, for example, the decision related to the prohibition of Enerly to drift networks, absolutely unjustified from the environmental point of view, since it affects one of the most selective fishing arts that may exist.If this environmental dimension in data management was not integrated, the Commission could unilaterally prohibit its willingness, the use of this or that fishing art.The amendment 4 requires the obligation imposed on scientists to deal with and transmit all the data to the competent authorities, including national and regional authorities, so that they can make their contribution to the decision -making process.

Mr. President, we are faced with a proposal that tries to incorporate a recommendation of the ICCOT into the community legislation - as has been said, from 1998 - which should be binding since June 1999 and which has come to Parliament only at the end of last year.The legislative laziness of the Commission on some issues should not be surprised if it were not because we are faced with a recommendation issued by one of the major international fishing organizations and which concerns the protection of a seriously threatened resource, tuna.The Mediterranean - in particular some of its areas - constitutes a very important reproduction area for red tuna, of enormous commercial value.For this, the ICCOT recommended that the Adriatic is considered to be closed to fishing and has made the conditions that regulate the capture of specimens of zero ages.As the rapporteur says, both measures are totally and widely motivated and therefore all that remains is to ask for approval.However, I agree with the honorable Gallagher who is forced to express his frustration due to the delay with which the Commission sets its mechanisms in motion and converts the recommendations into the Community legislation.We are still waiting, for example, the proposal for the regulation on the prohibition of importing the red tuna from Honduras and Belize, a recommendation that dates back to 1996. According to news in my possession, it seems that last January the DG for fishing has sent a note to the DG of trade and that the latter has already undertaken the preparatory works.However, four years to make the prohibition of import from countries that notoriously favor the flags of convenience is a completely unacceptable term, Mr. Commissioner.We listened to the explanations given by the Commission to illustrate the long internal process necessary for the transposition of a recommendation and the image that has come to us is that of an exasperating bureaucracy.As for the only advanced proposal to make the procedures relating to the legislation under discussion and by virtue of which the Council and Parliament would be more slender, I would like to express reserves.It is evident, however, that we must find a solution to the problem already in the context of the Commission's report on regional fishing organizations and, in any case, as soon as possible.I don't think someone in this classroom has something to object on the principle of protection of novel.In reality, it is often repeated that one of the general objectives of common fishing policy must be to protect and preserve the living resources of the marine environment.All this is commendable.And there is no doubt that red tuna has enormous importance from an environmental and financial point of view.Since I am an amateur fisherman, I too would like to go back to the 1930s, when the fishermen of the port of Scarborough, in Yorkshire, captured tuna with the line that weighed up to 830 pounds - I don't know what the equivalent in the metric system is.I am therefore favorable to the conclusions of the Combet and the principle of intergovernmental cooperation on environmental issues.I would not like, however, that we were here to discuss and turn our thumbs while Rome burns.Common fishing policy does not work.What has been said about conservation is certainly animated by noble principles, but in reality the system of quotas is bringing us directly to the environmental catastrophe.

It will be made up of qualified auditors and its independence must be and will be guaranteed by a new provision which will be added to the financial regulations.The new service will be responsible ahead of me and will be accompanied by an audit monitoring group chaired by my colleague, Ms. Schreyer, whom I am pleased to see in this enclosure this evening.As a budget commissioner, responsibilities already include relations with the Court of Auditors.This audit monitoring group will ensure rigorous and effective monitoring of internal audits.I would like to insist strongly on the fact that the modification of our control systems will in no way signify a relaxation.The proposed modification aims to improve the efficiency of systems, both in terms of contributions and in terms of measured and responsible results.I can also guarantee in Parliament that we do not advance to what is sometimes called a "big bang" type approach.The prior visa of financial control for each spending service will only be abandoned if the internal control system of a service turns out to be completely adequate.I am somewhat surprised that paragraph 10 of the draft resolution does not seem to take over the fundamental criticisms of the current centralized financial control function expressed in the two reports of the Committee of Experts.This committee clearly indicated the need to abolish the centralized prior visa.It was also clear on the need to separate the internal audit from financial control.Furthermore, I do not think that paragraph 10 fully reflects the opinion of the Court of Auditors issued in 1997. The Court will of course be able to give its opinion on the proposals to change financial regulations, but it is useful to recall the remarks that Mr. Karlsson made in this enclosure last month: the internal control of the Commission, he said is not vigorous enough to avoid incorrect operations.Thus, the financial controller issued a positive prior visa in most cases of mismanagement or irregularity which was discovered recently.At the same time, the function of the internal audit is not ensured in a coordinated manner by certain bodies, in particular by the financial controller itself, by the finance inspection and by certain units managing general departments.Originally, the centralized prior approval system undoubtedly aimed to ensure vigilance, but with the years, it had the perverse effect to reduce the extent of the feeling of managers in their decision.I don't think there is real disagreement between us in this regard.I deduce from paragraph 10 that the underlying concern for deputies is that there should be a carefully directed transition.This will certainly be what will characterize change, as deputies will be able to read it in the document on the reform strategy.Our objective, that of the Committee, that of the Court of Auditors, is not to abolish financial control, but to get rid of the centralized financial control and to do better.Before going to another area, I would add that we agree with the rapporteur to say that the existing internal audit function must be maintained up to the establishment, in a few months, from the new independent internal audit service.

congratulate the rapporteur Ms. Charlotte Cederschiöld on this report, who is an excellent starting point for the reinforcement of criminal protection against falsification of money with regard to the
